_header: Mine hearts joy is went away
Note: Correct order of lines 1-2, which are reversed in two witnesses. For other translations, see 384, 4307, 5216, 5349, 5352.

BLRoy7Ci.First Lines: þe joy of hour hert is away went…
BLRoy7Ci.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “Unrecorded Middle-English Verses.” 
             Anglia
         92 (1974): 55-78: 67 (first line only).

NLS18721.Transcription:
To sorwe & to care turned is my pleyþe ioyȝe of myn
                    herte al it is aweyþe garlond of myng heued falen is to
                    groundeÞat i euere sennede allas þat ilke stounde
NLS18721.Note:
First two lines reversed, and formerly 384; second copy in Grimestone’s notebook, with
                    same Latin text preceding.
NLS18721.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “Unrecorded Middle-English Verses.” 
             Anglia
         92 (1974): 55-78: 67 (first line only).

WorcF126.Transcription:
Myn hertes ioye is went a-wayto wo and sorwe ys turne my playOf
                    myn heued þe garland ys afallen to groundeþat I euer
                    sengetheþe weylaway þe stounde
